subject: Programming
title: The 10x Developer Myth
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The 10x Developer Myth.

hook.text: A study once claimed some programmers are ten times more productive than others. The myth stuck.

buildup.text: The original 1968 study measured individual coding speed, not team value or long-term maintainability.

discovery.text: A fast coder who writes unmaintainable code can create negative value for the team.

twist.text: The real 10x effect comes from developers who make everyone around them more productive.

climax.text: Mentoring, good documentation, and clean code multiply a team's output far more than speed alone.

punchline.text: The best developer makes the whole team better.

quiz.question: What creates the real 10x effect in software teams?
options: Developers who make the whole team more productive
